title: Rollout of smart and advanced meters hits 24.2 million
lead: ​Suppliers installed 760,000 domestic smart meters in Q1 2021, taking the number of smart and advanced meters in homes and small businesses to 24.2 million.
author: Alice Grundy

title: UKPN and ABB unveil new digital substation project dubbed Constellation
lead: ​ABB and UK Power Networks (UKPN) have unveiled a new digital substation protection and control project, which will enable more renewables to be integrated onto the grid.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Exploring a new emissions trading scheme
lead: Following the UK’s Emissions Trading Scheme (ETS) opening this month, Mark Bartholomew partner in the energy team at law firm Shakespeare Martineau takes a look at its origins, how its set to work, and whether it goes far enough.
author: Mark Bartholomew

title: WPD completes latest tender as its contracted flexibility capacity surpasses 450MW
lead: ​Western Power Distribution (WPD) has concluded its latest flexibility tender, securing 16.7MW across three contracts.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Demand for flexibility solutions set to hit £4.6bn by 2030
lead: ​The global demand for residential flexibility solutions is set to exceed £4.6 billion ($6.5 billion) by 2030, according to a new report from Guidehouse Insights.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: HMRC confirms 20% VAT rate for public EV charging
lead: ​Price hikes are on the horizon for InstaVolt’s charging, following clarity on the VAT rate for public charging, while other networks remain unaffected.
author: Alice Grundy

title: ​Current± Chats: Siemens' Bernard Magee on blending grid capabilities with e-mobility
lead: ​Current± caught up with Bernard Magee, director of EV Charging, Siemens UK&I, to talk about on-street charging in London and the edge that Siemens' grid capabilities gives it for e-mobility.
author: Alice Grundy

title: COVID-19 hits SSE profit by £170m but strong renewables help steady results
lead: ​The COVID-19 pandemic hit SSE’s operating profit by £170 million in the full year ending 31 March 2021.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Ember: Drax BECCS plant could cost £31.7bn in public subsidies
lead: ​Drax’s proposed bioenergy with carbon capture and storage (BECCS) plant could cost £31.7 billion in public subsidies according to a new report from Ember.
author: Alice Grundy

title: UKPN to create EV VPP following UK's largest flexibility tender
lead: ​Octopus Energy and Ohme are among companies to have been awarded a contract for a new virtual plant (VPP) set to largely utilise electric vehicles (EVs).
author: Alice Grundy

title: Elexon works to ‘level the playing field’ in the BM as Modification P399 is approved
lead: ​Elexon takes a step towards ‘leveling the playing field’ as Ofgem approves Modification P399.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Wind power once again smashes generation record as gusty weather continues
lead: ​Wind generation has once again smashed its previous record, with blustery weather on Friday 21 May driving it to a new peak of 17.7GW between 3.30-4:30pm.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Unsustainable transmission charges could jeopardise British infrastructure investment warns report
lead: Green energy infrastructure investment is being jeopardised by British regulations that favour EU electricity imports.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: BEIS unveils £166m to encourage 'rapid development' of CCUS and hydrogen
lead: Over 60,000 green jobs are to be created as the result of £166.5 million of funding announced today (24 May) by the Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy (BEIS).
author: Alice Grundy

title: Ofgem looks to support EV rollout as it announces winning projects receiving £300m
lead: ​Over 200 low carbon projects are getting a chunk of £300 million in investment from Ofgem to support electric transport and heat.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: ENGIE seals deal with Asda to rollout EV charging at 19 Yorkshire sites
lead: ​ENGIE is to install 50kW+ electric vehicle (EV) chargers at 19 Asda locations in West Yorkshire as part of a new partnership.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Fulcrum signs its largest smart meter contract worth £20m with supplier E
lead: ​Fulcrum is to manage 320,000 meter points as part of what is its largest smart meter contract to date.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Changeable British weather could risk grid security argues new report
lead: ​Increasingly changeable weather in Britain could put net zero and the security of the electricity grid at risk according to a new report.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Current± Chats: ENA Open Networks' Alex Howison on the need for a common agreement for flexibility services
lead: Current± caught up with Alex Howison, part of ENA’s Open Networks flexibility services product team and flexible solutions manager at Scottish and Southern Electricity Networks about the challenges of bringing in a common agreement, the framework approach and the need for greater flexibility to enable decarbonisation.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Ofgem survey finds EV owners 'more open' to embracing changes to energy usage
lead: ​Electric vehicle (EV) owners are three times more likely to say they’re on a time of use tariff than those without an EV, according to new research from Ofgem.
author: Alice Grundy
